entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 4:57PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storms Next Two Hours... Strong storms capable of producing frequent lightning, gusty winds, heavy downpours, and hail up to half inch in size will move across the North Pole and Fairbanks area through mid- evening. Travelers and recreators should maintain awareness and exercise caution as these storms move through.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 12:14PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain Expected Over The Southeast Interior Through Tuesday Night... The Southeast Interior will see heavy showers southeast of Delta Junction to Chicken today through Tuesday night. Expect 0.50 to 1.50 inch of rain southeast of Delta Junction to Eagle through Tuesday night, with the heaviest amounts along the Alaska Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 3:09PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up with Thunderstorms Possible Mid-to-late Week... Heat: * A heat-up begins Tuesday into the weekend. While hot, the heat is not looking too unusual for mid-June. Highs will run about 5-10 degrees above normal with 90s in the lower valleys and 80s in the Sierra valleys.
